overview:
Robyn is the Chief Technology Officer of Mashable. Prior to Mashable, Robyn was the head of product at Next Issue Media, the magazine and newspaper consortium (funded by News Corp, Conde Nast, Time Inc, Meredith and Hearst).

Before Next Issue Media, he headed up product strategy and technology for NBC Local Media, where he led the relaunch of the local media digital sites (nbcnewyork.com, nbcchicago.com, etc.) and the launch of the meta-review platform that powers the Feast restaurant review site (www.nbcnewyork.com/feast).

Robyn was also the Chief Technology Officer and a senior vice president of product management for Ziff Davis Media, but also a writer, covering multiple content areas, including but not limited to consumer electronics, car techonology, software and development, and networking. Robyn has also hosted the PCMag Radio podcast (subscribe in iTunes).

Robyn has appeared on CNN, CNN Headline News, MSNBC, CBS, Fox, Fox News and the WB network representing PC Magazine, GearLog.com, and ExtremeTech. His writing appears on ABCNews.com and Yahoo in addition to PC Magazine, eWEEK, CGW, and ExtremeTech.

Robyn has a masters of science in computer science from New York University (NYU).
